content:
Ah, I see the issue with the get_entities() call. Let me correct that:

```python
# First get and remove existing entities
drill = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill})[0]
furnace = get_entities({Prototype.StoneFurnace})[0]

print(f"Initial setup:")
print(f"Drill at {drill.position}")
print(f"Furnace at {furnace.position}")

# Pick up existing entities
pickup_entity(drill)
pickup_entity(furnace)
print("Picked up existing entities")

# Move to origin
move_to(Position(0, 0))
print("Moved to origin")

# Place drill first
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=Position(0, 0))
print(f"Placed drill at {drill.position}")

# Place furnace with enough space for inserter
furnace = place_entity_next_to(
    Prototype.StoneFurnace,
    reference_position=drill.position,
    direction=Direction.RIGHT,
    spacing=2  # Leave room for inserter
)
print(f"Placed furnace at {furnace.position}")

# Now place inserter between them
inserter = place_entity_next_to(
    Prototype.BurnerInserter,
    reference_position=drill.position,
    direction=Direction.RIGHT,
    spacing=1  # Put it halfway between
)
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Add fuel to all machines
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=5)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, inserter, quantity=1)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)
print("Added fuel to all machines")

# Wait for system to start working
print("Waiting for system to process ore...")
sleep(10)

# Check final status
print(f"Final status:")
print(f"Drill status: {drill.status}")
print(f"Inserter status: {inserter.status}")
print(f"Furnace status: {furnace.status}")
print(f"Furnace inventory: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")
```

This should properly get the specific entities we want to remove, then rebuild the setup with correct spacing. Let's see if this works better.
